intro: Psychotria siggersiana, commonly known as the red-eyed beauty, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and striking red flowers with white veins. Its flowers are typically clustered in inflorescences and are pollinated by various insects and birds. Psychotria siggersiana is also known for its psychoactive properties due to the presence of alkaloids such as dimethyltryptamine (DMT).
